title.title: Malaria Threats Map
title.subtitle: Tracking biological challenges to malaria control and elimination

cards.prevention: Resistance of malaria mosquitoes to insecticides used in core prevention tools of treated bed nets and indoor residual sprays threatens vector control effectiveness
cards.diagnosis: Gene deletions among some malaria parasites cause false negative diagnostic test results, complicating case management and control
cards.treatment: Resistance of malaria parasites to artemisinin – the core compound of the best available antimalarial medicines – threatens antimalarial drug efficacy
cards.invasive: The spread of anopheline mosquito vector species and their establishment in ecosystems to which they are not native poses a potential threat to the control and elimination of malaria

copyright.mobile: Click here to read the disclaimer that applies to the above map
copyright.content: The boundaries and names shown and the designations used on this map do not imply the expression of any opinion whatsoever on the part of the World Health Organization concerning the legal status of any country, territory, city or area or of its authorities, or concerning the delimitation of its frontiers or boundaries. Dotted and dashed lines or grey areas on maps represent approximate border lines or areas for which there may not yet be full agreement. The borders of the map provided reflect the current political and geographic status as of the date of publication (2017). However, the technical health information is based on data accurate with respect to the year selected. The disconnect in this arrangement should be noted but no implications regarding political or terminological status should be drawn from this arrangement as it is purely a function of technical and graphical limitations. Data source: Global Malaria Programme. Map production: Global Malaria Programme. World Health Organization. WHO 2019. All rights reserved.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.p1a: Data source: Global Malaria Programme. Map production: Global Malaria Programme. World Health Organization.
disclaimer.p2: Unless otherwise specifically stated, the information contained in this application has been made available to the World Health Organization (WHO) Global Malaria Programme by Ministries of Health or their development partners, or through extraction by WHO or contracted partners from publications in international peer-reviewed scientific journals. WHO therefore provides no assurance as to the validity, accuracy or completeness of this information.
disclaimer.p3a: Images and files generated from this application should be used only with reference to the subset displayed in accordance with the data filters applied. The following citation shall be conspicuously provided alongside images or files generated from the application: Source: WHO Malaria Threats Map: tracking biological challenges to malaria control and elimination (

step0.title: Welcome message
step0.p1: Welcome to the Malaria Threats data download dialogue!
step0.p2: This dialogue will allow you to download raw data from the WHO global databases on insecticide resistance in malaria vectors, on drug efficacy and resistance and on invasive vector species.
step0.p3: These three WHO global databases contain data submitted to us by our Members states, research institutions and partners, as well as data extracted from scientific publications. To credit their contributions, a column containing the sources of the data is included in every datasets. Please note that not every contributor has allowed us to share their data. Hence some of the data in Malaria Threats Map is not available for download. For data extracted from publications, please note that when the values of relevant variables were not directly provided in the publications or were analyzed differently than recommended by WHO, values were calculated from the reported data.
step0.p4a: The use of all data is subject to the
step0.p4bLinkText: Terms and Conditions of use for WHO data compilations, aggregations, evaluations and analyses
step0.p4c: . By using the Datasets or any presentations of data derived from them, you agree to be bound by and adhere to these Terms and Conditions, as may be amended from time to time by WHO at its sole discretion. If any datasets are credited to a source other than WHO, then those materials are not covered by these Terms and Conditions, and permission should be sought from the source.
step0.p5: Please acknowledge the use of these datasets by including the following reference in your publications: WHO, Malaria Threats Map, year, date of access, acknowledgement of the countries having provided the underlying data (in the event that the source refers to ministries of health or national malaria control programs of specific countries).
step0.p6: The Global Malaria Program is keen on tracking and showcasing the use of the Global databases. Therefore, we will ask you a few questions about the intended use of the data you wish to download.
step0.p7a: If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us on:
step0.p8a: Check here to indicate that you have read and agree to the
step0.p8bLinkText: Terms and Conditions of use for WHO data compilations, aggregations, evaluations and analyses

step2.title: Purpose of data download
step2.data_use: What will you use the data for?

data_use_options.vector: Development of new vector control tools
data_use_options.policies: Development of national policies, strategies and/or work plans (e.g. Malaria National Strategy Plan development, National treatment policy or guidelines, Insecticide Resistance Monitoring and Management Plans)

date_use_options_content.research: Please provide a short description of the project or research question for which data will be used (minimum 100 words)
date_use_options_content.policies: Please provide the title or a short description of the policy, strategy or plan for which data will be used
date_use_options_content.tools: Please describe briefly the new treatment, diagnosis or vector control tools you aim to develop (minimum 100 words)
date_use_options_content.date: When are you planning to finish your project, policy, strategy or plan?

step2.countries: Countries where the project, policy, strategy or plan will be implemented
step2.message: WHO is keen to improve the global databases and Malaria Threats Map to better serve the needs of our user community. Hence, WHO would like to engage with our user community to collect suggestions for improvement and to learn from different use cases and benefits that these products bring to them.
step2.consent1: I consent the World Health Organization on using my personal data to contact me regarding my experience using Malaria Threats Map and data from the global databases.
step2.consent2: I consent the World Health Organization on using the organization name and project descriptions I provided to showcase the uses of the global databases (no personal data will be shown).

TREATMENT_FAILURE_KM: % of patients with treatment failure, Kaplan-Meier
